Package ePortfolio

Class Investment

java.lang.Object
ePortfolio.Investment
Direct Known Subclasses:
MutualFund, Stock
public abstract class Investment extends Object
The Investment class serves as an abstract base class for various types of investments in an investment portfolio. It defines common properties and methods that can be utilized by all derived classes, such as stocks and mutual funds.

  • Constructor Details

    • Investment

      public Investment(String symbol, String name, int quantity, double price, double bookValue, double payment, double bookValueSold)
      Constructor to initialize the investment with its properties.
      Parameters:
      symbol - The symbol of the investment.
      name - The name of the investment.
      quantity - The quantity of the investment.
      price - The price of the investment.
      bookValue - The book value of the investment.
      payment - The payment for the investment.
      bookValueSold - The value of the sold investment.
